title: Non-aural - correct beaming in simple meter

content.question: Which of the following rhythmic notations is beamed correctly to reflect the beat unit?

choices.label: One measure of rhythms in four-four. A dotted eighth note, sixteenth, and eighth, beamed together. Two eighths, connected with a slur, beamed together. Eighth note followed by eighth rest. Two sixteenth notes, beamed together.
One measure of rhythms in four-four. A dotted eighth note, sixteenth, and eighth, beamed together. Quarter note, eighth note, eighth rest. Two sixteenth notes, beamed together.

One measure of rhythms in four-four. A dotted eighth note beamed with a sixteenth note. Two eighth notes, beamed together. The last eighth note is tied to the following note. Two eighth notes, beamed together. Eighth rest. Two sixteenth notes, beamed together.
One measure of rhythms in four-four. A dotted eighth note beamed with a sixteenth note. Eighth note, quarter note, eighth note, eighth rest. Two sixteenth notes, beamed together.

content.answer: One measure of rhythms in four-four. A dotted eighth note beamed with a sixteenth note. Two eighth notes, beamed together. The last eighth note is tied to the following note. Two eighth notes, beamed together. Eighth rest. Two sixteenth notes, beamed together.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in notated music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
